headline: Why Old Dominion Stock Rocketed Up at the Start of Trading Today
summary: Old Dominion Freight Line (NASDAQ: ODFL) is feeling the pinch from global trade uncertainty, but the impact isn't as bad as investors had feared.  Shares of Old Dominion were trading up 9% as of 10 a.m. ET after the company reported better-than-expected results Wednesday morning.  Trucking company Old Dominion earned $1.19 per share in the first quarter on revenue of $1.37 billion, beating Wall Street's $1.14 per-share consensus profit estimate and matching the top-line estimate.

headline: First look: Old Dominion Q1 earnings
summary: Old Dominion Freight Line beat first-quarter expectations on Wednesday but lowered its capex budget as demand weakness lingers. The post First look: Old Dominion Q1 earnings appeared first on FreightWaves.

raw.headline: First look: Old Dominion Q1 earnings
raw.summary: Old Dominion Freight Line beat first-quarter expectations on Wednesday but lowered its capex budget as demand weakness lingers. The post First look: Old Dominion Q1 earnings appeared first on FreightWaves.

headline: Old Dominion beats quarterly profit estimates on higher pricing
summary: -Old Dominion Freight Line beat first-quarter profit estimates as stronger pricing helped offset a steep drop in shipments, sending its shares up 3% on Wednesday.  Less-than-truckload (LTL) revenue per hundredweight, a key performance indicator for freight companies, rose 4.1% for the quarter, excluding fuel surcharges.  "The decrease in our first-quarter revenue was primarily due to a 6.3% decrease in LTL tons per day that was partially offset by an increase in LTL revenue per hundredweight," CEO Marty Freeman said.

"The decrease in our first-quarter revenue was primarily due to a 6.3% decrease in LTL tons per day that was partially offset by an increase in LTL revenue per hundredweight," CEO Marty Freeman said.

headline: Old Dominion Freight Line’s (NASDAQ:ODFL) Q1 Earnings Results: Revenue In Line With Expectations
summary: Freight carrier Old Dominion (NASDAQ:ODFL) met Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q1 CY2025, but sales fell by 5.8% year on year to $1.37 billion. Its GAAP profit of $1.19 per share was 4.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Old Dominion: Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The Thomasville, North Carolina-based company said it had profit of $1.19 per share. The results beat Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of 10 analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of $1.15 per share.
